tool.name: UpdateRouteLocation

param.name: in_features_route_id_field
param.dialogReference: The field in the input feature layer that contains the route identifier.
param.pythonReference: The field in the input feature layer that contains the route identifier.

param.name: route_layer_route_id_field
param.dialogReference: The field in the LRS layer that contains the route identifier.
param.pythonReference: The field in the LRS layer that contains the route identifier.

param.name: measure_field
param.dialogReference: The field that will have begin measure value written to it
param.pythonReference: The field that will have begin measure value written to it

param.name: end_measure_field
param.dialogReference: The field that will have end measure value written to it
param.pythonReference: The field that will have end measure value written to it

param.name: rounding_digits
param.dialogReference: Provide an integer value to round the measures.
param.pythonReference: Provide an integer value to round the measures.

param.name: use_m_from_route_point
param.dialogReference:
The arcpy.Polyline.queryPointAndDistance function returns both

  1. the nearest PointGeometry on the line nearest to the input point as well as

  2. the distance between the start point of the line and that point.

Setting this parameter to True will return the M value from item 1, whereas False will return item 2.
param.pythonReference:
The arcpy.Polyline.queryPointAndDistance function returns both

  1. the nearest PointGeometry on the line nearest to the input point as well as

  2. the distance between the start point of the line and that point.

Setting this parameter to True will return the M value from item 1, whereas False will return item 2.

tool.summary: Given a feature class of located route events from a previous year's LRS with manually updated geometry, this tool will snap that geometry to the specified route ID in an updated LRS.
tool.usage:
WARNING: This tool modifies the input feature class.

Intended workflow

  1. User has a feature class with route ID and begin and end measure fields.

  2. User edits the geometry and / or LRS that features were located against is updated

  3. User runs this tool to update the measure fields to match the updated geometry.

scriptExample.title: Update route location info
scriptExample.code: arcpy.UpdateRouteLocation_wsdotroute(in_features="./BridgeUpdates.gdb/BridgeOn", route_layer="./Sample.gdb/StateRouteLrs", in_features_route_id_field="UniqueRID", route_layer_route_id_field="RouteIdentifier", measure_field="arm_beg", end_measure_field="arm_end", rounding_digits="3", use_m_from_route_point=True)

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by Jeff Jacobson for WSDOT
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Given a feature class of located route events from a previous year's LRS with manually updated geometry, this tool will snap that geometry to the specified route ID in an updated LRS.
